content: Michelle is going to Ft. Bragg today to talk to military families. Surprisingly, it seems as if the 1st lady is interested in making military families' lives easier. I'm not sure how to do that but I applaud her for following through. I can't remember the last time a 1st lady did any more than a cursory visit overseas. Maybe we should look to Michelle for the "change we can believe in"...after all, behind every good man theres usually a strong woman nudging him along in the right direction.

content: I am glad I am not AD anymore and have to endure these D&G's. Remember when Ms Clinton came to HI as 1st Lady. They were trying to russle up service peeps to attend her PR thang. It got to the point where people were going to get ordered to go. LMAO. We even had some nitwit suggest we salute her. Throughout my career I tried to avoid when politicians came to base. I always thought it was patronizing unless they served before. You know who the sincere ones are by statements they made. And since this person has said negative things about America I put it down as patronizing. But, maybe some good will come out of it and she will get a clue.
reply: I am glad I am not AD anymore and have to endure these D&G's. Remember when Ms Clinton came to HI as 1st Lady. They were trying to russle up service peeps to attend her PR thang. content: quote: Surprisingly, it seems as if the 1st lady is interested in making military families' lives easier. I'm not sure how to do that but I applaud her for following through. I couldn't agree more. If nothing else, she brings attention to a highly deserving group of serving Americans -- "They also serve who only stand and wait". I will not denigrate her efforts until she gives grounds to do so ... and so far she has only given cause for applause. IMHO, to pre-judge her commitment and motivation is churlish.
quote: Surprisingly, it seems as if the 1st lady is interested in making military families' lives easier. I'm not sure how to do that but I applaud her for following through.

content: all I remember about mucky-mucks coming to Bragg is they all wanted to see a mass drop. It didn't matter, it seemed, what the winds on the drop zones were going to be - out ya went. Ruined my day a couple times.. them quick releases never did come apart like they said they did... One Flag......One Heart......One Nation............EVERMORE
